definition[0]: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an audience
example[0]: She bowed and left the stage.
example[1]: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
example[2]: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
definition[1]: to bend your body over something, especially in order to see it more closely
example[4]: Teague sat at his desk, bowed over a book.
definition[2]: to bend, or to make something bend
example[5]: The trees bowed in the wind.
example[6]: His back was bowed under the weight of the heavy bag.
definition[3]: the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience
example[7]: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
example[8]: The music ended and the girl took a bow.
example[9]: He gave a final bow just as the curtains came down.
definition[4]: the front part of a ship
definition[5]: a weapon used for shooting arrows, made of a long thin piece of wood held in a curve by a tight string
definition[6]: a knot of cloth or string, with a curved part on either side and two loose ends, worn in the hair as decoration or for tying shoelaces
example[11]: Ella wore a bow in her hair.
example[12]: long chestnut hair tied back in a bow
definition[7]: a long thin piece of wood with a tight string fastened along it, used to play musical instruments such as the violin or cello
definition[8]: to play a piece of music on a musical instrument with a bow3
